channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Emma Mellow selected as National Party candidate for Central Auckland
item.description: National's Emma Mellow will be up against Labour's Helen White, the Green's Chloe Swarbrick, and TOP's Tuariki Delamere.

item.title: Alice Snedden's Bad News Episode 1: Migrant Sex Workers
item.description: Bad News - (PG rating. Some language may offend.) Alice Snedden visits Madame Mary's place for this episode and talks to Dame Catherine Healy and former minister of immigration Iain Lees-Galloway about New Zealand's laws on sex workers.

item.title: Wellington city street brawls: More people, more fights
item.description: There has been an increase in serious violence in Wellington with a number of fights breaking out in the city's entertainment district at night.

item.title: Notorious South Auckland nightclub set for sale
item.description: A notorious nightclub in South Auckland which was linked to a shooting in 2017 will close its doors at the end of the month.

item.title: Talley's skipper fined for marine reserve fishing, company denies responsibility
item.description: Liability for a breach of the Marine Reserves Act extends beyond the skipper already charged, a lawyer for MPI says.

item.title: Have you seen Rita Morarji?
item.description: Police are appealing for sightings of a woman who went missing from an address in north-west Auckland last month.

item.title: Train drivers' plea to public; 'Look at signs, bells, whistles'
item.description: Train drivers are pleading with the public to be more careful at railway lines to prevent near misses and deaths.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases in managed isolation
item.description: There are no new Covid-19 cases in New Zealand today.

item.title: Jury deliberates in retrial of former teacher accused of abuse
item.description: The jury has retired to deliberate in the trial of a former Auckland school teacher accused of abusing six teenage boys.

item.title: Behind the legend of Madam Flora MacKenzie
item.description: Black Sheep - Flora MacKenzie was a hard drinking, hard talking brothel owner from the 1960s and '70s who won the affection of sex workers, police and punters alike.

item.title: Students at state integrated schools more likely to gain University Entrance, research shows
item.description: The special character schools have the best results for the best price compared with private or state alternatives, new research shows.

item.title: NZ student increase 'won't make up shortfall' in international income
item.description: Polytechnics and universities are warning an expected leap in domestic enrolments next year will not make up for the loss of foreign students due to the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: Red Cross giving $40k of food vouchers to stranded foreigners a day
item.description: More than $40,000 worth of food vouchers are being handed out daily by the Red Cross to foreigners stranded because of Covid-19.

item.title: Skipper fined after crashing while using phone
item.description: The skipper of an Auckland ferry has been fined after crashing into a navigation buoy at 50km/h because he was on his phone.

item.title: Kiwi roaming in backyards? Minister launches biodiversity strategy
item.description: The biodiversity strategy - Te Mana o te Taiao - sets out goals for protecting and restoring nature.

item.title: Cancer patients going without potentially life-saving treatment
item.description: Some New Zealand cancer patients are going without potentially life-saving treatment because of rising Covid-19 cases in Melbourne.

item.title: Two charged after fatal van crash on SH6 earlier this year
item.description: Two people have been charged following a fatal crash in Southland in February.

item.title: Hi-lab: NZTA's billion-dollar roadbuilding method labelled a 'looming disaster'
item.description: Faced with broken highways in Waikato and Wellington regions, the Transport Agency has staked a billion dollars on a roadbuilding method that is difficult to get right, hard to repair and that lacks a proven track record.
